slokas: अर्जुन उवाचकिं तद्‌ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम ।अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: What is Brahman? What is the self? What are actions, O Purushottama? What is the manifested, and what is the unmanifest?

slokas: अधियज्ञ: कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन ।प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभि: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: How can I know You, O Madhusudana, at the time of death? And how can I meditate on You, O Lord, in meditation?

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते ।भूतभावोद्भ‍वकरो विसर्ग: कर्मसंज्ञित: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: The indestructible, transcendental living entity is called Brahman, and his eternal nature is called the self. Action pertaining to the development of these material bodies is called karma, or fruitive activities.

slokas: अधिभूतं क्षरो भाव: पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् ।अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: The perishable nature is the adhibhuta, the soul is the adhidaiva, and I am the adhiyajna in this body of embodied beings.

slokas: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् ।य: प्रयाति स मद्भ‍ावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशय: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: And whoever, at the end of his life, quits his body, remembering Me alone, at once attains My nature. Of this there is no doubt.

slokas: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् ।तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भ‍ावभावित: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Whatever state of being one remembers when he quits his body, that state he will attain without fail.

slokas: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च ।मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशय: ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, at all times remember Me and fight. With mind and intellect absorbed in Me, you will come to Me without doubt.

slokas: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना ।परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: With the mind engaged in the practice of yoga, not wavering, one reaches the divine supreme Person, O Arjuna, contemplating on Him.

slokas: कविं पुराणमनुशासितार-मणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्य: ।सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप-मादित्यवर्णं तमस: परस्तात् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: One should meditate on the ancient poet, who is the ruler of the mind, and who is most pleasing to the mind. He is the creator of all and has an inconceivable form. He is of the color of the sun and is beyond the darkness.

slokas: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेनभक्त्य‍ा युक्तो योगबलेन चैव ।भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्य-क्स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: At the time of death, the yogi who is engaged in devotion with a steady mind and the power of yoga, and who enters the life breath between the eyebrows, attains the divine supreme person.

slokas: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्तिविशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागा: ।यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्तितत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: What the knowers of the Vedas call imperishable, that is what the ascetics, free from desire, enter. Those desiring Brahman live a life of celibacy. I will explain to you briefly their path.

slokas: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च ।मूध्‍न्‍‍र्याधायात्मन: प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Restraining all the gates, the mind seated in the heart, the yogi of controlled mind, the prana in the head, established in yoga, steadfast.

slokas: ॐ इत्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् ।य: प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: One who departs by leaving the body while remembering Me alone as the syllable Om, he attains the supreme goal.

slokas: अनन्यचेता: सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यश: ।तस्याहं सुलभ: पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिन: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: For one who always remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O son of Pritha, because of his constant engagement in devotional service.

slokas: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दु:खालयमशाश्वतम् ।नाप्‍नुवन्ति महात्मान: संसिद्धिं परमां गता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Having reached Me, the great souls are not subject to rebirth, which is transient and full of suffering. They have attained the highest perfection.

slokas: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्ल‍ोका: पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन ।मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: From the world of Brahman down to the world of earth, all are subject to rebirth, O Arjuna. But on reaching Me, O son of Kunti, there is no rebirth.

slokas: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदु: ।रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जना: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: For a thousand ages of the gods is one day; and one night also is a thousand ages.

slokas: अव्यक्ताद्‍ व्यक्तय: सर्वा: प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे ।रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: From the unmanifested, all the manifested beings arise at the advent of the day; at the advent of the night, they merge into the unmanifested alone.

slokas: भूतग्राम: स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते ।रात्र्यागमेऽवश: पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: This very same multitude of beings, having come into existence again and again, is dissolved at nightfall, O Partha, and comes into being again at daybreak.

slokas: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातन: ।य: स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Beyond this manifested world is another unmanifested eternal realm. That realm does not perish when all beings perish.

slokas: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहु: परमां गतिम् ।यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: The imperishable is said to be unmanifest; that is called the ultimate goal. That is My highest abode, attaining which they do not return.

slokas: पुरुष: स पर: पार्थ भक्त्य‍ा लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया ।यस्यान्त:स्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: That Supreme Personality of Godhead, Partha, can be attained by unalloyed devotion. Although He is present within everything, He is situated beyond everything.

slokas: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिन: ।प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: "O best of the Bharatas, I shall now explain to you the time at which the yogi who has failed attains to the state of non-return and that at which he attains to return."

slokas: अग्न‍िर्ज्योतिरह: शुक्ल‍ः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् ।तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जना: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: The fire, the light, the day, the fortnight, the bright fortnight, the six months, the northern course - those who depart by this path attain the light; they do not return to this world; that is the way to the highest goal.

slokas: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्ण: षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् ।तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Smoke, night, and the dark fortnight are the time for the southern solstice. When the yogi attains the moonlight, he is released.

slokas: श‍ुक्ल‍कृष्णे गती ह्येते जगत: शाश्वते मते ।एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुन: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: The paths of light and darkness are considered eternal in the world. By one, a person goes never to return; by the other, they come back again.

slokas: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन ।तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: O Partha, the yogi who knows this does not get deluded. Therefore, be engaged in yoga at all times, Arjuna.

slokas: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तप:सु चैवदानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् ।अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वायोगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: Knowing this, the yogi surpasses all the results of the Vedic rituals, sacrifices, austerities, and charitable acts, and reaches the supreme, primeval abode.
